evidence.text: Person B: Thank you for taking care of my Laszlo.
Person A: Oh yes. I wrote for a popular national paper at home; Magyar Nemzet.

Person A: Oh, that's fine, just fine. Feel free to call me Elizabeth if you prefer it.
Person A: Thank you. I attended University in England!

Person B: Philadelphia. To visit family.
Person A: Ah, yes. The American cousin! The city then! Us, as well.
Person A: Well, don't just stand there. Let us give you and your Auntie a lift.
Person A: I'm proud of you. Make love to me tonight.

Person B: My dearest Zsofia! Mazel tov! She is so beautiful - your spitting image!
Person B: Don't be mad but your Uncle Laszlo insisted I enclose a few banknotes for you and Binyamin. We hope he won't be offended, and that it's not too difficult to change these into the local currency.
Person B: Here: I am so alone. Perhaps more alone than I have ever been. Your uncle has closed a door to me. The man I married is inside but the lock's combination, I cannot decipher...
Person B: He no longer attends synagogue. When I ask him why, he will not reply. Perhaps his own narcissism will no longer allow him a relationship with our community.

Person A: Shame.
Person B: Yes. A terrible shame.
